title: JavaScript Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript basics

questions.question: What is the correct syntax for referring to an external script called 'app.js'?
questions.explanation: The 'src' attribute is used to specify the path to an external JavaScript file.

questions.question: How do you write 'Hello World' in an alert box?
questions.explanation: The alert() function is used to display an alert box with a message.

questions.question: How do you create a function in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Functions in JavaScript are declared using the 'function' keyword followed by the function name and parentheses.

questions.question: How do you call a function named 'myFunction'?
questions.explanation: Functions are called by writing the function name followed by parentheses.

questions.question: How to write an IF statement in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: IF statements in JavaScript use the syntax: if (condition) { code }

questions.question: Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable?
questions.explanation: The = operator is used for assignment in JavaScript.

questions.question: What will the following code return: Boolean(10 > 9)?
questions.explanation: 10 is greater than 9, so the expression evaluates to true.

questions.question: Is JavaScript case-sensitive?
questions.explanation: JavaScript is case-sensitive. Variables named 'myVar' and 'myvar' are different.

questions.question: Which method is used to remove the last element from an array?
questions.explanation: The pop() method removes and returns the last element of an array.

questions.question: What is the correct way to write a JavaScript array?
questions.explanation: Arrays in JavaScript are created using square brackets with comma-separated values.
